text: Why did my monthly bill change this month?
screenTitle: Several factors can contribute to an increase in your bill:
screenSubTitle: To better understand the specific reasons for the increase in your bill this month, we recommend reviewing your bill statement, which provides a detailed breakdown of charges.

data.content: If you were previously benefiting from a promotional rate or discount that has expired, your bill may have returned your standard rate.
If you added new services, upgraded your plan or obtained new Internet or TV equipment, this may result in an increase in your monthly charges.
Occasionally, you may see one-time charges on your bill for services, equipment installations or special requests.
Taxes and regulatory fees imposed by government authorities can fluctuate, affecting the total amount on your bill.
If there were changes to your billing cycle, such as the addition of partial charges for services outside your regular billing period, it could temporarily increase your bill.

text: How can I lower my bill?
screenTitle: We understand that managing expenses is important, and there are several ways you can explore to potentially lower your bill:

data.content: Enroll in Auto Pay and Paperless Billing to receive additional discounts.
When you sign up for both Internet and Mobile service, you can save big on your bill.
